noun.description: The avoidance of excess or extremes, especially in one's behavior or political opinions.
examples: he urged the police to show moderation

noun.description: The retardation of neutrons by a moderator.

phrases: nuts can be eaten in moderation
I've heard many, many times that you can eat these other things in moderation.
There's nothing wrong with eating fatty foods, as long as it's in moderation.
They have the trick of drinking alcohol in moderation.
Be casual, active, and have an outgoing personality, but do it in moderation.
origin: Late Middle English: via Old French from Latin moderatio(n-), from the verb moderare to control (see moderate).
